format: A data frame with 898 observations on the following variables.
title: Galton's dataset of parent and child heights
description:
Description
In the 1880's, Francis Galton was developing ways to quantify the
heritability of traits.  As part of this work, he collected data on
the heights of adult children and their parents.
reference:
Entries were deleted for
those children whose heights were not recorded numerically by Galton,
who sometimes used entries such as "tall", "short", "idiotic",
"deformed" and so on.

parameters.sex: the child's sex: F or M
parameters.height: the child's height as an adult (in inches)
parameters.nkids:
the number of adult children in the family, or, at least,
the number whose heights Galton recorded.
parameters.family: a factor with levels for each family
